Description: Limestone relief fragment of a battle scene with defeated Asians. The fragment is part of a large composition depicting the siege of a Near Eastern city, showing several Asians mens falling down the city wall. This fragment depicts the bottom of the scene, with a man lying on his back at the bottom of the wall (which appears to the right), while feet and hands of other men are also visible. Traces of pigments (yellow skin and red hair indicating they are not Egyptians) are still detectable.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr Harry Reginald Holland Hall
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. Naville and S. Clarke, The Temple of Deir el-Bahari, 1910, MEEF 30, pl. 9C D. Arnold, in A. Oppenheim, D. Arnold, D. Arnold & K. Yamamoto (eds), Ancient Egypt Transformed. The Middle Kingdom, New York 2015, 164-6.
